description: Currently, if you pass a flavor_id of a deleted for the v2/flavors/​{flavor_id}​ API call, it will return the flavor even though it has been deleted. The API shouldn't return a deleted flavor unless it is explicity requested for with any other parameter.
title: Flavors v2,v3/flavors/​{flavor_id}​ API should not return deleted flavor

comments.content: Currently, if you pass a flavor_id of a deleted for the v2/flavors/​{flavor_id}​ API call, it will return the flavor even though it has been deleted. The API shouldn't return a deleted flavor unless it is explicity requested for with any other parameter.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~timello

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/54401
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
I don't think this is a straigtforward fix.

Deleted flavors may still be in use by running instances so its quite a valid request to retreive information about them. At the very least we need the ability to specify that we want to show information for a deleted flavor. 

Its unclear whether this is intentional behavior or not (being able to show deleted flavors) so I think its probably worth bringing up on the mailing list to see if we should change it for V2. 

For V3 I think we need some wider changes to the flavors API, and am planning on bringing it up at summit
